Description: Shoulder sherd of Milesian Fikellura pottery amphora; interior reserved; exterior, white slip: row of black painted addorsed ivy leaves with dots in between above dividing band consisting of row of short strokes; at junction of shoulder and body, traces of undetermined black painted decorative pattern.
Curator's comments: Cook (1933-1934) suggests that the decorative pattern at the bottom of the sherd is perhaps the ear and tail of a hare on the body.
Bibliographic references: CVA British Museum 8 / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain 13, British Museum 8 (8, no. 6)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GF.067)
